page.title: 01Goathland Moorland
page.content: The inhabitants of this moorland Hill area number about 500. The main dwelling area is the village of Goathland. The rest of the are contains small hamlets, outlying cottages and farms. The area is totally unspoiled even though tourists have discovered it's beauty and tranquility. There is a wealth of flora and fauna to be studied. Sheep farming and a small amount of arable farming is carried on here. The preserved north Yorkshire moors railway proves to be a great tourist attraction, the scenic route and the thrill of travelling on a steam train drawing many people to the moors during the spring, summer and autumn. The rural way of life has been maintained by the holding of country fairs and produce shows.
